sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A declaratioun of the Kings Maiesties intentioun and meaning toward the lait actis of Parliament Adamson, Patrick, 1537-1592. James I, King of England, 1566-1625.
[24] p.
By Thomas Vautroullier [i.e. R. Field?], Imprinted at Edinburgh [i.e. London] : 1585 [i.e. 1588?]
Written by Patrick Adamson for James I. At foot of title: Cum priuilegio regali. The imprint is false; possibly printed in London by R. Field in 1588 (STC). Signatures: A-C⁴. In this edition the device on the title page has an oval border in a scroll-work frame. A reissue of STC 21948.3, with quire A and C1r mostly reset, the rest reimposed. Line 5 of title has "PARLIAMENT" (no period). Identified as STC 21948 on reel 396:6. Reproductions of the originals in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery and the British Library.
=======
A declaratioun of the Kings Maiesties intentioun and meaning toward the lait actis of Parliament Adamson, Patrick, 1537-1592. James I, King of England, 1566-1625.
[24] p.
By Thomas Vautroullier [i.e. R. Field?], Imprinted at Edinburgh [i.e. London] : 1585 [i.e. 1588?]
Written by Patrick Adamson for James I. At foot of title: Cum priuilegio regali. The imprint is false; possibly printed in London by R. Field in 1588 (STC). Signatures: A-C⁴. In this edition the device on the title page has an oval border in a scroll-work frame. A reissue of STC 21948.3, with quire A and C1r mostly reset, the rest reimposed. Line 5 of title has "PARLIAMENT" (no period). Identified as STC 21948 on reel 396:6. Reproductions of the originals in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery and the British Library.
Thomas Vautroullier [i.e. R. Field?]
